sen.j: 右方（高麗楽）に属する高麗壱越調 （こまいちこつちょう）の二人舞だが、一人舞の場合は曲名を「落蹲」と言う。
sen.e: Although it is futarimai (dance in pairs) in Koma-ichikotsucho (one of Japanese chromatic scale based on Em) that belongs in uho (the right side), also known as Komagaku music, the piece is called 'Rakuson' when performed as hitorimai (solo dance).

sen.j: 紺青色の龍頭を模した舞楽面を着け、銀色の桴（ばち/細い棒のこと）を携える。
sen.e: Players wear Bugaku (court dance and music) masks representing deep blue-colored dragon heads and carry silver drumsticks.

sen.j: 黄色系統の色の紗地に窠紋の刺繍をした袍を用い、その上に毛縁の裲襠 (りょうとう)と呼ばれる袖の無い貫頭衣を着装し、銀帯を締める。
sen.e: They wear ho (outer robe/vestment) embroidered with kamon (one of yusoku-monyo, traditional design motifs) on yellow-colored silk gauze, and keberi ryoto (sleeveless poncho with fur edging worn, on top of outer robe), a type of kantoi (simple type of clothing consisting of a large piece of cloth with a hole in the middle for the head) over the ho, and do up a silver band.

sen.j: 女性や少年少女が舞う場合もあり、その場合は、舞楽面を着けずに山吹の挿頭花を挿した前天冠を着け、歌舞伎舞踊と同様の舞台化粧をする場合がある。
sen.e: Women, as well as boys and girls, may also perform the dance, in which case they may put on maetengan (a charm of the front of cap) with kazashi bana (snapped branch of flower or tree put in the hair or the cap) in it and wear stage makeup as in Kabuki dance, without wearing Bugaku masks.
